text.0: come fain for booty let us seek to indra yet more shall he increase his care that guides us.
text.1: will not the indestructible endow us with perfect knowledge of this wealth of cattle.
text.2: i fly to him invisible wealthgiver as flies the falcon to his cherished eyrie.
text.3: with fairest hymns of praise adoring indra whom those who laud him must invoke in battle.
text.4: mid all his host he bindeth on the quiver he driveth cattle from what foe he pleaseth.
text.5: gathering up great store of riches indra be thou no trafficker with us most mighty.
text.6: thou slewest with thy bolt the wealthy dasyu alone yet going with thy helpers indra.
text.7: far from the floor of heaven in all directions the ancient riteless ones fled to destruction.
text.8: fighting with pious worshippers the riteless turned and fled indra with averted faces.
text.9: when thou fierce lord of the bay steeds the stayer blewest from earth and heaven and sky the godless.
text.10: they met in fight the army of the blameless then the navagvas put forth all their power.
text.11: they like emasculates with men contending fled conscious by steep paths from indra scattered.
text.12: whether they weep or laugh thou hast oerthrown them o indra on the skys extremest limit.
text.13: the dasyu thou hast burned from heaven and welcomed the prayer of him who pours the juice and lauds thee.
text.14: adorned with their array of gold and jewels they oer the earth a covering veil extended.
text.15: although they hastened they oercame not indra their spies he compassed with the sun of morning.
text.16: as thou enjoyest heaven and earth o indra on every side surrounded with thy greatness.
text.17: so thou with priests hast blown away the dasyu and those who worship not with those who worship.
text.18: they who pervaded earths extremest limit subdued not with their charms the wealthbestower.
text.19: indra the bull made his ally the thunder and with its light milked cows from out the darkness.
text.20: the waters flowed according to their nature he raid the navigable streams waxed mighty.
text.21: then indra with his spirit concentrated smote him for ever with his strongest weapon.
text.22: indra broke through ilībiśas strong castles and Śuṣṇa with his horn he cut to pieces.
text.23: thou maghavan for all his might and swiftness slewest thy fighting foeman with thy thunder.
text.24: fierce on his enemies fell indras weapon with his sharp bull he rent their forts in pieces.
text.25: he with his thunderbolt dealt blows on vṛtra and conquered executing all his purpose.
text.26: indra thou helpest kutsa whom thou lovedst and guardedst brave daśadyu when he battled.
text.27: the dust of trampling horses rose to heaven and Śvitrās son stood up again for conquest.
text.28: Śvitrās mild steer o maghavan thou helpest in combat for the land mid tugras houses.
text.29: long stood they there before the task was ended thou wast the master of the foemens treasure.
